column4: ok this is getting ridiculous. did rm ~/.Xauthority; sudo touch ~/.Xauthority && sudo chown $LOGNAME  ~/.Xauthority && sudo chmod 775 ~/.Xauthority and reinitiated update. Still getting "cannot copy user's xauthorization file"
what's the command line way to update all available update files?
sudo apt-get update all? or something?
what are you trying to do?
just trying to update my damn ubuntu box ;)
if you do sudo apt-get update  then   sudo apt-get dist-upgrade  that should do it
the dist-upgrade will not install a new version
ok cool
upgrade is used to install the newest versions of all packages currently installed on the system
dist-upgrade, in addition to performing the function of upgrade, also intelligently handles changing dependencies with new versions of packages"
gotcha
curious then - what is the command line to actually do a distro upgrade?
that would be   sudo update-manager -d
cool. appreciate your help!
no problem :)
does this help   http://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/karmic/man5/hibernate.conf.5.html
does that also address suspend as well?
not sure but still checking
http://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/hardy/man8/pm-suspend.8.html
I don't even have an /etc/hibernate directory. possibly was deleted after my fsck
hold on
